text: The Journal of Behavioral and Experimental Economics is a bimonthly peer- reviewed academic journal covering behavioral and experimental economics. It was established in 1972 as the Journal of Behavioral Economics, and was renamed the Journal of Socio-Economics in 1991. It obtained its current name in 2014. The editor-in-chief is Ofer Azar (Ben-Gurion University of the Negev). According to the Journal Citation Reports, the journal has a 2017 impact factor of 0.966. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Economics journals Category:Socioeconomics Category:Behavioral economics Category:Publications established in 1972 Category:Elsevier academic journals Category:Bimonthly journals Category:English-language journals
title: Journal of Behavioral and Experimental Economics
